storyInfo: Kazdel charges into a Catastrophe to escape pursuit. Theresis takes in a girl from the wastes and names her Ascalon. A boy named Manfred approaches Theresa and Theresis.

attributes.content: How tiny we seem when we stand beside the tracks of this ship.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Yes, it's a most impressive war machine.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: With their bodies as barriers, the Nachzehrer halted its advance at a tremendous cost. The Banshee's shrieks, powerful enough to shatter consciousness, only managed to force the Leithanians to retreat below deck...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: If not for the Catastrophe and the rough terrain in this valley—
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: We're so far behind, and time is running out.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Kazdel must have equally powerful weapons, if not more so.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: All our previous attempts have failed...
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: A century ago, few believed we could build a nomadic city out of Kazdel, yet we did. If we are to catch up to them now, we cannot afford to take the conventional path.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: We have word from the Damazti. The battleships on the horizon are slowing down.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Have they given up?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: No, the Kurfürst's orders were to continue the pursuit, but the commander of the fleet ordered them to slow down.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: They're concerned about the Catastrophes and the terrain. They've seen what happened to this ship.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: At the current rate, we can expect to engage them at dusk.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: We have bought enough time for Kazdel to retreat.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Theresa looks back at the two storms entwining on the wastes, trying to catch a glimpse of the city.
She sees nothing. Where is Kazdel now? Is it still moving through the storm? Are the people in the shelters safe?
The storms are converging. Our retreat has been cut off. A battle is inevitable... Theresis?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I never thought I'd see you lose focus on the battlefield.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: What's that?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: That's...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The storms rage, the young taunting the old.
The newborn storm slams into the dying storm to the war drums of thunder.
Roiling air currents clash and combine between the two storms...
Violence begets peace, and a passage appears where the storms converge.
Lightning flashes and thunder cracks.
A path through the storm.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: The storm...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Let's go, Theresa. The storm has given us a path.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Those who survive through it will have another chance.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: We'll do it together.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The Damazti Cluster passes their command to every Sarkaz present.
The warriors see their leaders walk into the storm side by side and follow with no hesitation.
The procession advances into the tempest, the strong supporting the weak, the brave encouraging the fearful.
Do you see that, Theresis?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Within the roar of the tempest, they seem to hear the voice from the snowstorm in that childhood dream.
They see—
...The prophecy.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The thin, cloaked figure turns at the sound of her voice and sees the storm-bound procession.
Theresis sees a child. Mist, gilded by the setting sun, shrouds her shoulders, rising and blending with the shrieking winds above.
He takes off his gauntlet and stretches his bare hand into the mist.
The mist dissipates, and in his bloodied hand is the stone blade that the child is holding.
(Slurring) Yew... argh! Gra... grab!
What are you doing here?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: (Slurring) Hom. Yew... hom! Hom!
(Slurring) Yew! Came in! Home!
The child wrestles the blade from Theresis's hand and points it again at Theresis and the procession behind him.
There is no difference between man and beast to the child who grew up in the wastes.
You want to kill me?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: (Slurring) Keel... kill you!
Nobody taught her how to speak. She simply emulates the sounds made by those who pass by.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: ...Theresis?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Theresis looks down silently at the thin figure.
Let me show you how to hold a knife.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: (Slurring) You!
The child hesitates for a moment, before putting her knife in Theresis's outstretched hand.
(Slurring) ...Me. You! Bring, me... bring, me!
Theresis gazes into Theresa's eyes.
Prophecy.
'A sword to slay the regent king, a spear to pierce the royal ring.'
But they have never cared much for prophecy.
Very well.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Come with me. The home of the Sarkaz is not on the barrens.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: 'Do you have a name?'
'Name? Me.'
'From now on, you have a new name.'
'Ascalon.'
Ten days later...
The nomadic city of Kazdel, Kazdel
Look, doctor! The furnace has been relit!
attributes.name: Excited Sarkaz

attributes.content: Is it moving? The city's finally moving? Ouch...
attributes.name: Excited Sarkaz

attributes.content: Careful! Your wounds might open again...
attributes.name: Babel Doctor

attributes.content: I've got to go to the furnace. The furnace burns again, and Kazdel still sails...
attributes.name: Excited Sarkaz

attributes.content: The Leithanians didn't manage to kill us!
attributes.name: Excited Sarkaz

attributes.content: Oh, er, I didn't mean you, doctor.
attributes.name: Excited Sarkaz

attributes.content: Come with me to see it. You deserve the same honor as the warriors who survived.
attributes.name: Excited Sarkaz

attributes.content: But... I'm not Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Babel Doctor

attributes.content: You people are heroes, too.
attributes.name: Excited Sarkaz

attributes.content: Come watch Their Highnesses command the Goliath to support the leaning furnace! Watch the sparks fly when iron hammers beat upon the broken core!
attributes.name: Excited Sarkaz

attributes.content: Hear the elegy of the Banshee, and witness the final journey of fallen heroes when they enter the furnace to fuel it!
attributes.name: Excited Sarkaz

attributes.content: This used to be an occasion that only the Sarkaz could see.
attributes.name: Excited Sarkaz

attributes.content: I would love to go, but there are still a lot of wounded to treat.
attributes.name: Babel Doctor

attributes.content: Alright, tell you what, I'll bring back a couple bottles of booze and some fresh fruit, and we'll...
attributes.name: Excited Sarkaz

attributes.content: You're not allowed to drink! And who the heck drinks in a medic tent?
attributes.name: Babel Doctor

attributes.content: Come on, it's just a little flesh wound.
attributes.name: Excited Sarkaz

attributes.content: No means no! It's your Oripathy that's the problem! Not to mention you're a terrible drinker.
attributes.name: Babel Doctor

attributes.content: When did you ever see me drink? Oh, that time when I was drunk and came to you with a bunch of Oripathy bombs.
attributes.name: Excited Sarkaz

attributes.content: Look, that was the only time in all these years. You know I can't afford booze.
attributes.name: Excited Sarkaz

attributes.content: *sigh* I can't stop you... why don't you go yourself?
attributes.name: Babel Doctor

attributes.content: Won't be the same without you.
attributes.name: Excited Sarkaz

attributes.content: But... I'm a Leithanian...
attributes.name: Babel Doctor

attributes.content: And? Do you support those nobles who profit off war?
attributes.name: Excited Sarkaz

attributes.content: I ran away from home because I couldn't stand them!
attributes.name: Babel Doctor

attributes.content: There you have it. Hm? Wait a second. You say you ran away from home? Were you noble—
attributes.name: Excited Sarkaz

attributes.content: No!
attributes.name: Babel Doctor

attributes.content: I was kind of thinking, your equipment doesn't look like it's from Babel—
attributes.name: Excited Sarkaz

attributes.content: —Well, I won't speculate. It does nobody any good.
attributes.name: Excited Sarkaz

attributes.content: So, you can go on your own.
attributes.name: Babel Doctor

attributes.content: I doubt the soldiers on the front lines would get along with a Leithanian...
attributes.name: Babel Doctor

attributes.content: When I saw the Leithanians string my father up by a sewer entrance to humiliate him, I never imagined I could befriend a Caprinae doctor either.
attributes.name: Excited Sarkaz

attributes.content: Back then, the only people who showed us any kindness were poor, Infected, or both.
attributes.name: Excited Sarkaz

attributes.content: Right, enough of the sad stuff. Be back in a jiffy.
attributes.name: Excited Sarkaz

attributes.content: Seriously, since when did the Sarkaz become so glib-tongued with me?
attributes.name: Babel Doctor

attributes.content: I wonder if this count as progress, Theresa...
attributes.name: Babel Doctor

attributes.content: In any case, Kazdel is moving again. Things will get better.
attributes.name: Babel Doctor

attributes.content: Back already? Well, it's about time you laid down—
attributes.name: Babel Doctor

attributes.content: Oh, sorry, I thought you were someone else.
attributes.name: Babel Doctor

attributes.content: Wait, your wounds are really bad... nobody treated your Arts burns?
attributes.name: Babel Doctor

attributes.content: The Leithanians did it. My son's dead. They burned him alive before my very eyes. I was the only one who lived.
attributes.name: Brooding Sarkaz

attributes.content: ...At least let me see your wounds.
attributes.name: Babel Doctor

attributes.content: They burned him alive. He was screaming. They used Arts to hang him in the air, for everyone to see.
attributes.name: Brooding Sarkaz

attributes.content: My brothers are dead. My captain is dead. The Leithanians stood on the high ground, their raised staffs looked just like...
attributes.name: Brooding Sarkaz

attributes.content: With bloodshot eyes, the nearly deranged Sarkaz fixates on the doctor's staff abandoned in the corner.
The emblem of the home she had left behind hangs from the staff.
Like a real...
attributes.name: Brooding Sarkaz

attributes.content: The doctor does not sense the hostility.
She lifts his top to inspect the wound, but feels a chill run up her spine.
You're armed...
attributes.name: Babel Doctor

attributes.content: Why didn't the guards check you...?
attributes.name: Babel Doctor

attributes.content: The light of the Soul Furnace lights up the night sky above Kazdel like the midday sun.
The fire's crackles echo like a mournful growl, a somber tribute to the fallen who have become its fuel.
All the Sarkaz set their eyes on the sky that night.
No one notices the light from one of the field hospital's windows go out.
Your Highness?
attributes.name: Brooding Sarkaz

attributes.content: Why was I brought here...? Oh, yes, I have good news to report...
attributes.name: Brooding Sarkaz

attributes.content: What news?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: We won.
attributes.name: Brooding Sarkaz

attributes.content: We defeated the Leithanians, Your Highness. Me, my son, and the Blue Blood Squad. We won, we won...
attributes.name: Brooding Sarkaz

attributes.content: Are you not glad, Your Highness? Were we too slow...?
attributes.name: Brooding Sarkaz

attributes.content: Blake! My son, bring me the battle plan! Son! Son?
attributes.name: Brooding Sarkaz

attributes.content: Sorry, Your Highness, I don't know where my son went...
attributes.name: Brooding Sarkaz

attributes.content: You killed a doctor, one who has served Kazdel for years, treating Oripathy patients.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Kazdel? Doctor? No, you misunderstand, your Highness.
attributes.name: Brooding Sarkaz

attributes.content: I only fight Leithanians.
attributes.name: Brooding Sarkaz

attributes.content: Have you read his emotions, Theresa?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Pain, confusion, madness. He has driven himself mad to escape the painful memories.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: He doesn't even know what crime he committed.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The others do.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: The guards discovered him brawling with another Sarkaz amid shattered casks of liquor, which ignited and spread fire throughout the field hospital.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: All await the King's response. But you cannot be the one to do it.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Leave it to me.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Your Highness! General! I gave my all to defeat the Leithanians!
attributes.name: Brooding Sarkaz

attributes.content: Was I wrong to do so? Your Highness!
attributes.name: Brooding Sarkaz

attributes.content: Take him away.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: ...His name is Logan, given to him by his mother, who was one of the first Babel engineers.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: He hardly uses any Arts, but the guards were hypnotized by Arts. Someone is behind this.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The Military Commission will not investigate the Sarkaz for the sake of an outsider, not after they've just been through another ordeal.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Neither should Babel.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: We have no choice. The war has just ended.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Babel should withdraw from military and political affairs, at least for the time being.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: You know that's not what Babel is about in the first place.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I do, but many don't.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I will define the parameters for Babel's activities. Bable members will continue to serve Kazdel's medical, educational, and technological needs from this area.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The Military Commission will continue to protect them. But we must make every effort to avoid conflict.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: There will come a day when the repressed hatred boils over, and even we will be powerless when that day comes.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Kazdel is in urgent need of a change. We have to solve the Originium problem... soon.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But even that won't solve all our problems.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I've always known.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: There you are, Ascalon.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: What have you seen in this city?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Deth... People cry... People die.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Cry? Cry... tears?
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Theresis stretches out his hand. A delicate stone knife lies in its palm.
Knife! My...
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Keep it safe. A warrior should treasure her weapon.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I will teach you how to sharpen your blade.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: But it's up to you to decide whom it cuts.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: You're too impatient, Theresis. She's not ready to understand these things yet.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: She has to understand, sooner or later.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Maybe. But for now, what we should do is give the frightened child a little bit of peace. Do you like this city, Ascalon?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Compared to the armored general, Ascalon does not like this Sarkaz woman crouched before her.
She seems to see through all of her thoughts, leaving no secrets—a most dangerous thing in the wastes.
But she cannot bring herself to be hostile to this gentle Sarkaz.
No need to be afraid. You know I don't mean you any harm. Come, touch my horn. We're the same.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: ...Warm, here.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Warm, me.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Yes, warm. Hatred and killing are not the only way to solve a problem.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: (Slurring) Way? Probem?
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Theresa says no more. It is difficult for a girl who has known nothing but the wastes to understand certain words, even with the help of the King of Sarkaz.
She takes Ascalon's hand.
It's like the wound on your palm. Weapons can't heal it. Only time and medicine can.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Aw!
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: It's okay. I've cleaned your wound. You'll need to take care of it.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Be patient. One day, you'll wake up and find that it doesn't hurt anymore.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: ...Yeah!
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Babel Classroom, Kazdel
...No one. Here.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: We'll wait a little longer. It's not lesson time yet. They'll come—
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Look, it's Theresis.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Casualty report from the Military Commission. There are many children, most of them students.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: The ones that lived...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Their parents are no longer willing to let the outsiders of Babel teach them.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Plus, if memory serves, many of Babel's teachers have already left out of fear.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: You're troubling yourself too much with trivial matters, Theresa. You need to rest. We still have to—
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I want to wait a little longer, Theresis.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: ...Very well.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: He does not leave. The classroom is eerily quiet.
Theresa closes her eyes and recalls the students who used to fill the classroom.

attributes.text: 'They said we can get potatoes for coming to school!'
'I didn't understand that one, Your Highness. Do you have any simple stories?'
'You said you went to the outside with mercenaries when you were our age?'
'There's a sea between Sargon and Iberia? What's a boat? Why can't we go up on deck? Why would we throw up?'
'Leithanian spires? Are they like our furnace?'
'People who are nice to us? But Dad says there's no foreigners like that.'
'But the teachers here are nice to us!'

attributes.content: Students come and go. But she always managed to get them to return.
But this time, no one came.
General Theresis! Your Highness! I—
attributes.name: Brave Boy

attributes.content: You!
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: The hilt of a stone knife hits the boy in the chest. Although unable to break free, the boy strains to look up at the tall, gaunt girl who has him pinned.
I saw General Theresis come this way. I just wanted to—
attributes.name: Brave Boy

attributes.content: Theresa, Your Highness! You're here, too! This classroom... are you teaching?
attributes.name: Brave Boy

attributes.content: Put down the knife, Ascalon.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: ...Your Highness!
attributes.name: Brave Boy

attributes.content: You were looking for me?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Yes. I came to seek an answer for the children who lost their parents. I know the Military Commission will take care of them, as it took care of me...
attributes.name: Brave Boy

attributes.content: But will this change anything? What if another war comes?
attributes.name: Brave Boy

attributes.content: I want to change things, but I don't know what I can change, or what I should change.
attributes.name: Brave Boy

attributes.content: The two rulers gaze upon the fearless child, each arriving at their own answer inside.
What's your name?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Manfred.
attributes.name: Brave Boy

attributes.content: Dad, we've been standing at the door forever. Why can't we go in?
attributes.name: Sleepy Child

attributes.content: Mommy's hurt very badly. She needs some quiet to rest. We shouldn't bother her.
attributes.name: Goodluck

attributes.content: But I miss Mom...
attributes.name: Sleepy Child

attributes.content: Daddy misses her too, but not now... we'll go home together once I come back.
attributes.name: Goodluck

attributes.content: Where are you going, Dad?
attributes.name: Sleepy Child

attributes.content: I have to leave the city for a bit, to make the people who hurt Mommy pay.
attributes.name: Goodluck

attributes.content: Stay here with Mommy and wait for Daddy.
attributes.name: Goodluck

attributes.content: Can you stay, Daddy? We'll figure out a way to make Mommy better, I promise...
attributes.name: Sleepy Child

attributes.content: Do you like Mommy's name?
attributes.name: Goodluck

attributes.content: Odda... yes, it sounds very nice.
attributes.name: Sleepy Child

attributes.content: It's your name now.
attributes.name: Goodluck

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Sleepy Child

attributes.content: I'll teach you to fight the bad guys with Mommy's weapon once I get back.
attributes.name: Goodluck

attributes.content: Okay! I'll beat up the bad guys who hurt Mommy!
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: But will beating up the bad guys make her feel better?
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: You'll understand someday... Odda.
attributes.name: Goodluck

attributes.content: ...I'll be back. Wait for me.
attributes.name: Goodluck

attributes.content: Goodluck turns around, toward the crystal-infested city wall.
The only thing left that ties him to this city is Odda.
Odda... and Odda.
